hero.title: Study in the UK
hero.subtitle: Your Gateway to World-Class Education
hero.description: Discover the benefits of studying in the UK with expert guidance on university applications, student finance, and immigration support.

sfe.title: Student Finance England Benefits
sfe.subtitle: Financial Support for Your Studies
sfe.tuitionDesc: Cover your full tuition fees with a loan that you only start repaying after graduation
sfe.maintenanceDesc: Get support for living costs while you study
sfe.repaymentDesc: Only start repaying when you earn above the threshold
sfe.additionalDesc: Extra funding available for disabled students and those with dependents

q1.question: What is Student Finance?
q1.answer: It’s a UK government loan that covers the cost of university tuition fees.

q2.question: Who can apply for Student Finance?
q2.answer: British or EU citizens with pre-settled or settled status in the UK.

q3.question: Can I apply with pre-settled status?
q3.answer: Yes, if you meet the residency requirements.

q4.question: What is the difference between pre-settled and settled?
q4.answer: Pre-settled is temporary (5 years), settled is permanent. Both can qualify you depending on residency.

q5.question: What is a Foundation Year?
q5.answer: A preparatory year before starting a degree, to improve academic skills and English level.

q6.question: Do I have to pay anything during the course?
q6.answer: No. Repayment starts only after graduation and when earning above a certain threshold.

q7.question: Which universities accept Student Finance?
q7.answer: Most public universities in the UK accept it.

q8.question: How much does Student Finance cover?
q8.answer: Up to £9,250 per year for tuition fees.

q9.question: Can I get help with living costs?
q9.answer: Yes, through the Maintenance Loan if you live away from your family.

q10.question: How do I apply for Student Finance?
q10.answer: You apply online on the Student Finance England website. You can also get help from an advisor.

q11.question: What documents are needed?
q11.answer: Passport, pre/settled status, proof of address, and academic transcripts.

q12.question: How long does approval take?
q12.answer: Usually 4 to 8 weeks after submitting all documents.

q13.question: Can I choose any course?
q13.answer: Yes, as long as it’s eligible and approved by Student Finance.

q14.question: Can I study part-time?
q14.answer: Yes, part-time students can also receive funding.

q15.question: My English isn’t great. Can I still apply?
q15.answer: Yes, many universities offer Foundation Year with English support.

q16.question: I’m over 30. Can I still study?
q16.answer: Yes! There is no age limit for undergraduate courses with Student Finance.

q17.question: Does it cover online courses?
q17.answer: Usually not. Student Finance mainly covers in-person courses.

q18.question: What if I drop out?
q18.answer: Inform the university and Student Finance. You may have to repay for the time attended.

q19.question: What happens if I leave the UK?
q19.answer: You may still need to repay based on your income abroad.

q20.question: Are there interest rates?
q20.answer: Yes, but rates depend on your income after graduation. They are fair and income-based.

q21.question: Do I need a visa to study with Student Finance?
q21.answer: Not if you have pre-settled or settled status. Otherwise, a student visa is required.

q22.question: What is UCAS?
q22.answer: It’s the official UK university application system. Most courses use it.

q23.question: Is Student Finance a loan or a scholarship?
q23.answer: It’s a government loan that is repaid through taxes after graduation, only if you earn enough.

q24.question: What is student life like in the UK?
q24.answer: It’s culturally rich, with great student support, events, discounts, and facilities.

q25.question: Can I work while studying?
q25.answer: Yes, most students can work part-time during their studies.

q26.question: What if I need help with my application?
q26.answer: You can book a consultation with our advisors for personalized support.

q27.question: How do I contact you for more information?
q27.answer: You can use the contact form on our website or book a meeting with an advisor.

q28.question: Can I get funding for a Master's degree?
q28.answer: Yes, there are specific loans available for postgraduate courses.

q29.question: What if I have a disability?
q29.answer: You can apply for additional support through Disabled Students' Allowances (DSAs).

q30.question: Can I apply for funding if I’m already studying?
q30.answer: Yes, you can apply for funding for the next academic year if you meet the criteria.

about.title: About Us
about.description: We are dedicated to helping students navigate the complexities of studying in the UK, from university applications to student finance and our mission is to provide clear, accessible information and personalized support to ensure your success in the UK education system.
about.teamDescription: Our experienced advisors are here to guide you every step of the way, ensuring you have the best possible experience.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Have questions? We're here to help! Reach out to us via the contact form or book a meeting with one of our advisors.

services.title: Our Services
services.description: We offer a range of services to support your journey in the UK, including university application guidance, student finance advice

universities.title: UK Universities
universities.description: Explore the diverse range of universities in the UK, each offering unique programs and opportunities for international students.

bookMeeting.description: Schedule a one-on-one consultation with our advisors to discuss your study plans, student finance, and any other questions you may have.

aboutPage.title: About Us
aboutPage.description: We are committed to providing expert guidance and support to students pursuing education in the UK. Our mission is to simplify the process of university applications, student finance, and other essential aspects of studying abroad.
experienceItems: Years of expertise in academic advising
Comprehensive understanding of the UK education system

contactPage.title: Contact Me
contactPage.description: Have questions or need assistance? Feel free to reach out via the contact form below, and I'll get back to you as soon as possible.

servicesPage.title: My Services
servicesPage.description: I offer a range of services to support your academic journey, including university application guidance, student finance advice, and personalized consultations.

universitiesPage.title: UK Universities
universitiesPage.description: Explore the diverse range of universities in the UK, each offering unique programs and opportunities for international students. Learn more about their offerings and how to apply.

benefitSection.title: Who Can Benefit from Foundation Year Courses?
benefitSection.intro: Foundation Year courses are an excellent opportunity for those who wish to study in the UK but do not have the academic qualifications necessary to enter directly into an undergraduate degree.

studentsLimited.title: Students with Limited Academic Experience
studentsLimited.content: If you don't have the qualifications needed to directly enter an undergraduate course, a Foundation Year offers you the chance to update your knowledge and skills for a smooth transition to higher education.

professionals.title: Professionals Returning to Academics
professionals.content: If you've been out of formal education for a while and wish to re-enter the academic environment, the Foundation Year provides preparatory support.

international.title: International Students and Immigrants
international.content: For those who have recently moved to the UK and need a year of adaptation before starting their undergraduate degree.

nonTraditional.title: Students with Non-traditional Qualifications
nonTraditional.content: If you have diplomas or qualifications that aren't directly recognized in the UK, the Foundation Year could be the bridge to your desired degree.

whatIsSection.title: What is a Foundation Year?
whatIsSection.paragraph1: The Foundation Year is a preparatory year designed to equip students with the academic skills necessary to enter a full undergraduate course.
whatIsSection.paragraph2: During this year, students receive training in subjects like mathematics, academic English, and other essential knowledge relevant to their chosen degree.
whatIsSection.paragraph3: By the end of the year, you will be ready to begin your full degree course with a solid foundation for success.

personalized_consultancy.title: Personalized Consultancy
personalized_consultancy.description: Receive guidance on which university and course are best suited to your goals and profile. We take into account your academic background, career aspirations, and personal preferences to recommend the perfect educational path.

application_support.title: Complete Application Support
application_support.description: From selecting the right institution to completing your enrollment and finalizing the details. We guide you through every step of the application process, ensuring all documentation is properly prepared and submitted.

finance_support.title: Student Finance Support
finance_support.description: Assistance in applying for student loans and maintenance loans, with a thorough explanation of available options. We help you understand the financial aspects of studying in the UK and maximize your funding opportunities.

accommodation_support.title: Accommodation and Logistics Support
accommodation_support.description: Help finding accommodation and providing information on living expenses in the UK. We assist you in finding suitable housing options and understanding the cost of living in different UK cities.

expertise.title: Expertise and Experience
expertise.description: With years of experience in UK higher education, we understand the complexities of the application process and can help you navigate them successfully.

personalized_approach.title: Personalized Approach
personalized_approach.description: Every student's journey is unique. We provide tailored guidance that considers your individual circumstances and goals.

comprehensive_support.title: Comprehensive Support
comprehensive_support.description: From initial consultation to arrival in the UK, we're with you every step of the way, ensuring a smooth transition to your new academic life.

ongoing_assistance.title: Ongoing Assistance
ongoing_assistance.description: Our support doesn't end with your acceptance. We continue to provide guidance throughout your academic journey in the UK.
